text: Peter Monks (born 3 October 1986) is a former footballer who played left back. Born in England, he represented British Virgin Islands at international level. ==Club career== Born in Truro, Monks has played club football for Exeter City, Dorchester Town, Taunton Town, Bridgwater Town, Weston-super-Mare, Paulton Rovers and Chippenham Town. Monks re-joined Bridgwater Town in 2011 following a two-year spell living in Australia. He signed a new contract with Weston- super-Mare in June 2013. Whilst at the club he had loan spells with Paulton Rovers and Chippenham Town during the 2013–14 season, before moving to Chippenham on a permanent basis the following season. ==International career== He made his international debut for the British Virgin Islands in 2015. He was invited to represent the nation by Daniel Barker, whose cousin works for the BVI Football Association. ==References== Category:1986 births Category:Living people Category:English footballers Category:British Virgin Islands footballers Category:British Virgin Islands international footballers Category:Exeter City F.C. players Category:Dorchester Town F.C. players Category:Taunton Town F.C. players Category:Bridgwater Town F.C. players Category:Weston-super-Mare A.F.C. players Category:Paulton Rovers F.C. players Category:Chippenham Town F.C. players Category:Association football fullbacks Category:National League (English football) players
title: Pete Monks
